verses.text: Come, and let us return unto the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*: for he hath torn, and he will heal us; he hath smitten, and he will bind us up.
After two days will he revive us: in the third day he will raise us up, and we shall live in his sight.

Then shall we know, ifwe follow on to know the \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*: his going forth is prepared as the morning; and he shall come unto us as the rain, as the latter andformer rain unto the earth.
Â¶ O Ephraim, what shall I do unto thee? O Judah, what shall I do unto thee? for your goodness isas a morning cloud, and as the early dew it goeth away.
Therefore have I hewed themby the prophets; I have slain them by the words of my mouth: and thy judgments are asthe light thatgoeth forth.
For I desired mercy, and not sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
But they like men have transgressed the covenant: there have they dealt treacherously against me.
Gilead isa city of them that work iniquity, and ispolluted with blood.
And as troops of robbers wait for a man, sothe company of priests murder in the way by consent: for they commit lewdness.
I have seen an horrible thing in the house of Israel: there isthe whoredom of Ephraim, Israel is defiled.
Also, O Judah, he hath set an harvest for thee, when I returned the captivity of my people.
